name: Asobi Seksu
comments: Dream pop band based in New York City

name: Laura Veirs
comments: Alt-folk singer-songwriter based in Washington state

name: Jackie Shane
comments: Toronto based 1960s cross-dressing soul singer. Unusual for the time, he was openly gay.

name: Marty Thomas
comments: Vocalist whose credits range from gospel music to Broadway show tunes

name: Rob Snarski
comments: A singer, a velvet-voiced troubadour. He took up the guitar in his teens and formed Chad's Tree in the 1980s with his singer, song-writer brother Mark Snarski He found his voice and the spotlight with part-time, holiday-band The Bottomless Schooners of Old, featuring members of The Triffids later going on to share vocal duties with David McComb in The Blackeyed Susans and singing the songs penned by McComb and founding member Phil Kakulas. Later, he took on the craft of song-writing himself. Rob has toured the globe with The Blackeyed Susans and as a guest vocalist with The Triffids and The Go-Betweens and has graced the same stage as Johnny Cash  Leonard Cohen and Nico [DE] amongst others not quite as popular.

name: Matt Walker
comments: Melbourne-based guitarist incl. dobro and lap-steel. Long history of collaboration with drummer Ashley Davies.

name: Vika and Linda Bull
comments: They came to prominence after singing backing vocals in Joe Camilleri band The Black Sorrows from 1988. They left that group early in 1994 to start their vocal duo.

name: Tony Azito
comments: An American eccentric dancer and character actor. During his career he was best known for comic and grotesque parts, which were accentuated by his lanky, hyperextended body.

name: Raymond J. Barry
comments: American film, television and stage actor.

name: Carolyn Wonderland
comments: Multi-instrumentalist whose principal instrument is guitar, singer and songwriter.  Wonderland is a blues artist.

name: ESP
comments: "Eric Singer Project", classic rock act formed by drummer Eric Mensinger, who replaced Peter Criss in Kiss at various times.

name: Circus of Power
comments: Hard rock band from the Lower East side of New York.

name: Rina Pia
comments: Flemish singer active in the 1950s and 1960s

name: Attermann
comments: Singer, bassist, composer and radio speaker.

name: Teo Macero
aliases: Prince Kalua and the Tropical Islanders
comments: Jazz saxophonist, composer, and record producer.  He may be best known as a producer, having produced, among others, Kind of Blue and Bitches Brew by Miles Davis, Monk by Thelonious Monk and Time Out by Dave Brubeck.

name: Machito
comments: Machito was born in Tampa, Florida and grew up in Cuba, returning to the United States in 1937.  He was a vocalist, maraca player, and leader of various Latin and Latin jazz orchestras.

name: Turk Murphy
aliases: Turk Murphy and His Jazz Band
Turk Murphy & His San Francisco Jazz Band
Turk Murphy and His San Francisco Jazz Band
Turk Murphy's San Francisco Jazz Band
comments: Dixieland and traditional trombonist based in San Francisco.  Murphy was also a vocalist.

name: Albert Nicholas
aliases: The Albert Nicholas Quartet with Art Hodes, Earl Murphy & Freddie Kohlman
comments: Dixieland and swing jazz reed player norn in New Orleans, Louisiana.  Nicholas' primary instrument was the clarinet.

name: The Milan College Jazz Society
comments: Jazz music group founded in Milano

name: Tiger Okoshi
comments: Born in Japan, Okoshi, a jazz fusion trumpet player,  came to the United States in 1972 and ultimately became a U.S. citizen.  He teaches at the Berklee College of Music.

name: Original Memphis Five
comments: Jazz band formed in New York City in 1917 and recorded from 1922 into 1931. They recorded under a variety of other names including Ladd's Black Aces, Jazzbo's Carolina Serenaders, Bailey's Lucky Seven, The Southland Six and The Cotton Pickers. The name 'Original Memphis Five' continued to be used later in configurations containing one or more of the original members.

name: Harry Parry
aliases: Harry Parry and His Radio Rhythm Club Sextet
Harry Parry and His Radio Sextet
Harry Parry's Radio Rhythm Club Sextet
comments: Welsh clarinetist, bandleader and occasional vocalist

name: Eddie Peabody
aliases: Eddie Peabody – Vocal Refrain by Eddie Peabody
comments: Vaudeville entertainer and multi-instrumentalist whose principal instrument was the plectrum (4-string) banjo

name: Sidse Babett Knudsen
comments: Actress who works in theatre, television and film. She is considered one of the top Danish actresses of her generation. Knudsen achieved international recognition for her leading role as fictional Danish Prime Minister Birgitte Nyborg in the Danish TV series "Borgen".

name: Arsen Dedić
comments: Singer-songwriter, poet and composer, who was prominent in Croatia as well as in former Yugoslavia. Also known as Luka Juras.

name: Joseph Robichaux
aliases: Joseph Robechaux and His New Orleans Rhythm Boys

name: The Cretones
comments: New wave group from Los Angeles, California, U.S.

name: Head East
comments: Hard rock, A.O.R. band from East Central Illinois

name: The North West Gospel Chamber Ensemble
Hannibal Marvin Peterson
comments: Jazz trumpeter and composer, including of music meant to be played by classical orchestras.  He now is known as Hannibal Lokumbe.

name: Booker Pittman
comments: Jazz musician who played clarinet, soprano sax and alto sax.  Pittman was also a vocalist. Pittman was born in the United States and was a grandson of Booker T. Washington. He moved to Brazil in 1937 where he was nicknamed "Buca".  His step-daughter, Eliana Pittman, with whom he recorded, is a famous Brazilian jazz singer and actress.

name: Arthur Collins
comments: Singer who recorded many early records, commencing in 1899

name: Byron Harlan
comments: Comic and ballad singer and early recording artist.

name: Alton Purnell
comments: Dixieland jazz pianist and sometime vocalist

name: Greg Laswell
comments: Singer-songwriter, guitarist and pianist. His performances have been featured a number of times on US television.

name: Sally Anthony
comments: Indie pop/rock singer-songwriter based in Indiana.

name: Gemma Bulos
comments: Singer-songwriter and activist, founder of the "A Single Drop" clean water project

name: Reginald Van Carreker
comments: Washington DC based smooth jazz / contemporary jazz vocalist and multi-instrumentalist

name: Two Russian Cowboys
comments: Flemish "punksurfrootsrock" group consisting of Luc Dufourmont en Hugo Bourgeois.

name: Yukihiro Takahashi
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer, record producer and actor, best known internationally as the drummer and lead vocalist of the Yellow Magic Orchestra.

name: David Vorhaus
comments: American-born classical bass player and electronic musician.

name: White Noise [GB]
comments: Electronic / avant-garde music project formed by David Vorhaus, Delia Derbyshire and Brian Hodgson. From their second album onwards, White Noise became Vorhaus' solo project.

name: Deon Yates
comments: Smooth jazz/contemporary jazz saxophonist, keyboardist and vocalist

name: Big City Orchestra
comments: Experimental collective based in San Francisco.

name: Beverly Kenney
comments: Jazz vocalist.  Although critically acclaimed, Kenney was not popular with the music buying public, at least in part to the growing success of rock 'n' roll, a type of music she despised.  She committed suicide through a combination of alcohol and barbiturates.

name: Sybel
comments: Electro / darkwave duo consisting of Adrian Ortiz (synths, programming), and Samir Farah (vocals, synths, programming)

name: Martin Breeze
comments: Melbourne based alt pop and jazz vocalist, songwriter and painter

name: The Great Crusades
comments: Rock band based in Chicago; formed in 1996.

name: Michael Hood
comments: Vocalist and multi-instrumentalist, though primarily a fingerstyle guitarist. He is based in New York.

name: The Marbles [US]
comments: Bass – John Haussmann Drums – Mike Saroski Guitar, Vocals – Mike Grau

name: Stickfigure
comments: Rock band led and co-founded in 1992 by former major league pitcher Jack McDowell.

name: Patrik Fitzgerald
comments: Singer-songwriter and an originator of folk punk

name: Ray Pilgrim
comments: Singer, songwriter, record producer and musician

name: Johnny Copeland
aliases: Johnny Copeland and His Soul Agents
comments: Blues guitarist and singer from Louisiana

name: Hayden Thompson
aliases: Hayden Thompson and His Southern Melody Boys
comments: Rockabilly and country music singer, guitarist and songwriter

name: Derwood Andrews
comments: Punk guitarist and vocalist born in Fulham, London

name: Jerry Byrne
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer from New Orleans. His first record, "Lights Out," recorded when he was still a teenager in high school, was a hit. That song was written by his cousin, Mac Rebennack (aka Dr. John).

name: Mike Sanchez
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer and pianist. London-born to Spanish parents, raised in Worcestershire and based in Bewdley/Kidderminster throughout most of his career. Resident in Spain since 2010.

name: Enter Chaos
comments: Melodic death metal band from Elblag

name: Morgan Babb
comments: Singer, songwriter, disc-jockey, radio station owner/operator and minister.

name: Joe Lee Wilson
comments: Gospel-influenced jazz singer born in Bristow, Oklahoma.

name: Doc Starkes
aliases: Doc Starkes and His Nite Riders

name: The Nite Riders
comments: R&B band formed in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in 1954 by bass player, Doc Starkes. Other members include Melvin Smith [vocals], Harry Crafton [guitar], Harry Van Walls [piano], Joe Sewell [tenor sax] and Jimmy Johnson [drums].

name: Jimmy Liggins
aliases: Jimmy Liggins and His Drops of Joy
comments: R&B guitarist, singer, songwriter and one of the most successful band leaders in the jump blues period of the late 1940s and early 1950s. His wild stage presence and manic delivery influenced Little Richard, Chuck Berry, Bill Haley and Elvis Presley.

name: Bill Johnson [US2]
aliases: Bill Johnson & The Four Steps of Rhythm
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer. Johnson was also part of the duo Sam & Bill, which released several singles.

name: Walter Douglas
comments: Owner of the Vanessa Records label.

name: Junior Rogers
comments: Blues guitarist, arranger and bandleader from Tulsa. Worked with Roy Milton .

name: Charles Sheffield
comments: Early-'60s R&B singer from Lake Charles, Louisiana.

name: Windsor King
comments: Lead singer (first tenor), songwriter and founder of the Brooklyn, NY based doowop group, The Cashmeres.

name: Jess Stacy
aliases: Jess Stacy and the Famous Sidemen
comments: Jazz pianist who was popular during the swing era.  He spent four years (1935-1939) with the Benny Goodman Orchestra .

name: Joan Steele
comments: Pianist and vocalist.  Her married name was Joan Steele Magaldi.

name: Lou Stein
aliases: Lou Stein His Piano and Orchestra
The Lou Stein Three, Four and Five
Lou Stein with Banjo and Rhythm Section
comments: Jazz pianist born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

name: String Trio of New York
comments: Avant-garde jazz chamber group founded in 1977.  The group has had several different violinists over the years, and continues as an active ensemble.

name: Butch Thompson
aliases: Butch Thompson and His Berkeley Gang
Butch Thompson's King Oliver Centennial Band
comments: Jazz pianist and clarinetist.  Thompson appeared weekly on Garrison Keillor's radio show, "A Prairie Home Companion".  Thompson is probably best known for his stride and ragtime piano performances.

name: Rick Allen
comments: Drummer. Celebrated for overcoming the amputation of his left arm in a 1984 accident and returning to play with Def Leppard.

name: Pepe Marquez
comments: Latin and soul music vocalist from Santa Barbara, California

name: Sennie Martin
comments: Singer-songwriter and trumpeter. He was lead vocalist for the Dazz Band and Kool & the Gang.

name: Flashy
comments: Reggae and R&B vocalist from Bequia

name: Main Gazane
comments: Smooth jazz group established by Minchello and Bob Magnuson (saxophone)

name: Pandora [MX]
comments: Female musical group formed by María Fernanda "Fer" Meade del Valle and the sisters María Isabel Lascurain Arrigunaga and María Teresa "Mayte" Lascurain Arrigunaga. Initially Fernanda Meade was part of the group until 1989, being replaced by Liliana Abaroa Suzarte for 7 years (1989-1996). Originally called "Las Jeans" (unrelated to Jeans ), and rebaptized in 1985 to "Pandora".

name: Babacar
comments: Caroline Crawley (who previously used to sing and play with Shelleyan Orphan ) and Boris Williams

name: 8 Eyed Spy
comments: No Wave band from New York City, consisting of Lydia Lunch and Jim Sclavunos Michael Paumgardhen, Pat Irwin and George Scott III

name: Steven Sater
comments: Lyricist, screenwriter and playwright. He has been a frequent collaborator with Duncan Sheik.

name: Lea Michele
comments: Singer and actress, best known for her role as "Rachel Berry" on the Fox TV series "Glee"

name: Divisi [US]
comments: Women's a cappella group from the University of Oregon.

name: Keri Noble
comments: Pop singer-songwriter and pianist from Fort Worth, Texas.

name: The Last Kinection
comments: Indigenous hip-hop group from Newcastle, New South Wales

name: Graveyard School
comments: Punk band based in New Jersey

name: The Ribeye Brothers
comments: Garage band based in Red Bank, New Jersey

name: Porro
comments: Rock and soul vocalist and guitarist based in Miami, Florida

name: Warren Peace
comments: Singer-songwriter and dancer, best known for his work with David Bowie in the 1970s.

name: Doc Terry
comments: Blues harmonica player based in St. Louis, born in Sunflower.

name: Clay Cook
comments: Songwriter, producer and musician. He co-wrote a number of songs with John Mayer on Mayer's first two albums.

name: Made
comments: Powerpop band based in La Spezia.

name: Ada
comments: House music musician, DJ and producer from Cologne, based in Hamburg

name: Duke Special
comments: Alt/folk singer-songwriter and pianist based in Belfast, Northern Ireland

name: Don West
comments: Trade union organizer, civil-rights activist and a well-known Southern writer and poet. Some of his verses were set to music by daughter and folk singer Hedy West.

name: John Fischer
comments: Christian author, singer, songwriter, and speaker.

name: Henry Boozier
comments: Trumpet player and songwriter from Texas

name: Yoshio Toyama
aliases: Yoshio Toyama and His Dixieland Saints
comments: Dixieland trumpeter heavily influenced by Louis Armstrong and occasional vocalist (in English).

name: Ranch Romance
comments: Western swing and alternative country band who took their name from a 1930s pulp Western magazine.

name: Due voci
comments: Vocal duo consisting of Tyler Hamilton and Kelly Levesque

name: Pavlo
comments: Guitarist of Greek descent from Toronto

name: The Lennon Sisters
aliases: The Lennon Sisters with Orchestra & Chorus
comments: Vocal group, initially consisting of four sisters from a family of 11 siblings.

name: Carol Deene
comments: Pop singer from Yorkshire in the north of England whose career was affected by serious car accidents in 1966 and 1974.

name: Dany Fischer
aliases: Dany Fischer et The Gentlemen Twisters
comments: Tunis-born early 1960s rock and roll singer.

name: Backlash [US]
comments: Hardcore band from Bergen County, New Jersey

comments: Singer, active as a recording artist in the 1960s

name: Bob Smit
aliases: Bob Smit & The Duke City Sextet

comments: Vocal quintet consisting of Olivier Berten, Nedjelka Candina, Johan Fostier, Maria-Helena Schoeps & Gilles Wiernik.

name: Al Bernard
comments: Vaudeville singer, who started out singing in blackface in minstrel shows

name: Milton Brown
aliases: Milton Brown and His Musical Brownies
comments: Bandleader and vocalist.  His group, Milton Brown and His Musical Brownies, is considered by many to be the first true Western swing band.

name: Gilad Atzmon
aliases: Gilad Atzmon & The Orient House Ensemble
comments: British jazz saxophonist, novelist, political activist and writer, originally from Israel.

name: Greta Ann
comments: Hairdresser from Liverpool that was a part-time entertainer.

name: Masaya Nakahara
comments: Experimental/noise musician, Nakahara is also an actor and an award-winning writer.

name: Donna Taylor
comments: Singer from Dallas, Texas, who won KVIL Radio's "Make Me a Star" competition in 1983.

name: Bessie Brown
comments: Classic blues singer.  Brown also appeared in musical reviews and appeared in cabarets.  Her recording career lasted some three years between 1925 and 1928.  She left show business in 1932.

name: Michel Simon
comments: Actor and singer and one of the "monstres sacrés" of French cinema.

name: Jean-Claude Bourchenin
comments: Singer, drummer uses Boubou and Luc Maldoror  as an alias

name: Paul Visconti
comments: Guitarist, singer, songwriter. Uses Paul Félix as an alias.

name: Johnny Dodds [US1]
aliases: Johnny Dodds and His Black Bottom Stompers
Johnny Dodds and His Chicago Boys
comments: One of the leading clarinetists in the New Orleans jazz style

name: George L. Cobb
comments: Composer, best know for ragtime instrumentals and songs

name: Kevin Blechdom
comments: Banjo player, singer, experimental musician and performance artist.

name: Snowboy
comments: Latin jazz / acid jazz fusion styled DJ, producer, percussionist and bandleader

name: Daniel Cirera
comments: Malmö born singer-songwriter based in Los Angeles

name: Dealership
comments: Indie rock band based in Berkeley, California

name: Sunny Domestozs
comments: Rockabilly band from Münster named after its vocalist/drummer. Founding members: Peter Hajunga aka "Tex Morton" (guitar) Oswald "Ossi" Carlos Münnig aka "Sunny Domestozs" (drums, vocals) Manfred Brasa aka "Manni Feinbein" (bass)

name: Ragnar Hovland
comments: Mostly known as writer, playwright and translator. Occasionally he is also vocalist and multi-instrumentalist.

name: Andrew Liles
comments: Prolific solo artist, producer of minimalistic, experimental and surrealistic music. Recording since the mid 80s and releasing numerous albums every year.

name: The Fallout Trust
comments: Guy Connelly - Guitar, Vocals, Programming Gavin Ellis - Bass Guitar, Vocals Matt Watson - Drums, Programming, Piano Jess Winter - Violin, Mellotron, Piano Joe Winter - Vocals, Design Matt Winter - Guitars, Piano

name: Black Raín [US]
comments: Industrial band from New York City

name: William Bryant
comments: Producer, songwriter and multi-instrumentalist. Co-writer with Howard Jones on much of the latter's earlier music.

name: Paul King [GB2]
comments: Irish-born vocalist and keyboardist, later an MTV and VH1 VJ

name: Red Rhythm
comments: House music duo of Cliff Randall and Simon Britton

name: Per Persson
comments: Guitarist, singer and songwriter Not to be confused with Per "Peps" Persson

name: Sigge Hill
comments: Country musician born in Umeå in Västerbotten

name: Johan Johansson
comments: Songwriter, vocalist, musician (drums, guitar, bass) and producer. He is most famous for his time as songwriter and drummer of the punk-rock band KSMB.

name: Doc Daugherty
comments: Songwriter and jazz musican, who played the saxophone and clarinet.

name: Ralph Butler
comments: Songwriter, responsible for the lyrics of many popular songs of the 1930s and later, mostly with comic or novelty elements.

name: Mandy Miller
comments: Best known for her movie roles as a child actor.

name: Joppe Pihlgren
comments: Singer, guitarist and songwriter born in Åmål. Also a TV presenter/producer and festival promoter

name: Chester Gaylord
comments: Baritone vocalist, particularly popular in the late 1920s and early 1930s, who was also a radio broadcaster. He was called "The Whispering Serenader".

name: Swing Cats
comments: Retro-swing/rockabilly group formed by two-thirds of Stray Cats .

name: The High Hatters
comments: Victor Talking Machine Company studio band

name: Henry Lange
aliases: Henry Lange and His Baker Hotel Orch.
comments: Pianist, composer and bandleader most active in the 1920s into the early-1930s

name: Marcie Miller
comments: Vocalist with the Ray Anthony band

name: Patricia Sosa
comments: Singer-songwriter with rock, soul and blues' influences. She began her career in 1975, with the cover band Nomady Soul. She created the rock band La Torre with Oscar Mediavilla in 1981, which was an immediate success, and played in the 1982 B.A. Rock. The band made several international tours, even to the Soviet Union. Patricia Sosa left the band in 1990, to start a solo career.

name: State Radio
comments: Alt rock band based in Massachusetts

name: Sam Cardon
comments: New Age and classical music composer with many credits in movies and TV.

name: Jet Motor Crash
comments: Hard rock band from Southern California

name: Academical Village People
comments: Male a cappella group formed at the University of Virginia

name: Ingram Hill
comments: Rock band based in Memphis, Tennessee

name: Aly & AJ
comments: Pop rock vocal duo, sisters Alyson and Amanda Michalka

name: Kim Kyung Ho
comments: Name in Korean: 김 경호. Hard rock vocalist.

name: Ian & Sylvia
aliases: Ian & Sylvia and The Great Speckled Bird

name: Mara & David
comments: Dresden based singer-songwriter duo of Mara von Ferne (vocals) and David Sick (acoustic guitar).

name: Audio Overdose
comments: Rock band based in Dallas, Texas.

name: J. C. Higginbotham
aliases: J. C. Higginbotham & His Six Hicks
comments: Although he mostly was recorded as a sideman, Higginbotham is considered to be one of the leading swing trombonists.

name: Picastro
comments: Slowcore and rock music band based in Toronto, Ontario.

name: Rex Stewart
aliases: Rex Stewart leads The Fletcher Henderson Alumni
comments: Principally a cornet player, Stewart also occasionally sang. After an 11-year stint with Duke Ellington from the mid-1930s to the mid-1940s, Stewart left the Ellington organization to lead his own groups.

name: John Stubblefield
comments: Working in rhythm & blues bands early in his career, Stubblefield was a jazz saxophonist who played in a variety of styles, including bop and free jazz.

name: The Reasonable Band
comments: Bluegrass, Western swing, and swing band.

name: Hot Dogs [US]
comments: Memphis-based pop/rock group, mining a similar musical vein to labelmate Big Star .

name: Glass Hammer
comments: Prog rock band formed in Tennessee.

name: Tony Kaye
comments: English keyboardist and songwriter, who was the original keyboard player for the progressive rock group Yes from 1968 to 1971, toured with David Bowie in 1975 to 76 for the "Station to Station" tour and then rejoined Yes from 1983 to 1995.

name: Hans Annéllsson
comments: Graduated guitarist, composer/musicologist, progressive music performer and pop singer.

name: Cairo
comments: Symphonic prog band based in San Francisco, California

name: Warpaint
comments: Experimental art rock group around Emily Kokal, Jenny Lindberg & Theresa Wayman

name: Papercranes
comments: Gainesville, Florida based band which features actress/singer Rain Phoenix on vocals.

name: Stanley Snail
comments: One-shot band assembled for the tribute performance below. Its name is a corruption of part of the song lyrics.

name: Shadow Gallery
comments: Prog metal band based in Pennsylvania.

name: Patrick Moraz
comments: Jazz/progressive/pop keyboardist, film composer and songwriter best known for his tenures as keyboardist in the rock bands Yes and The Moody Blues

name: Enchant

name: Alex Diambrini
comments: Italian-born contemporary jazz / smooth jazz guitarist and vocalist

name: Scars [US]
comments: One-off trio consisting of Kubsinki, Peter Auslan and Greta Brinkman

name: Winterbrief

name: Paul and Storm
comments: Comedy duo based in Washington, D.C.

name: Edmund Welles

name: Busted
comments: Pop rock band from Southend-on-Sea, Essex.

name: Diplo
comments: Musician, DJ, music producer, rapper and songwriter

name: Mark Hudson
comments: Record producer, musician and songwriter, born in Portland, Oregon

name: Tuli Kupferberg
comments: Poet, singer, satirical cartoonist, self-proclaimed "world's oldest rock star" and mainstay of the New York counter-culture, Kupferberg inspired one of the characters in Allen Ginsberg 's poem "Howl".

name: Steve Stevens
comments: Electric guitar virtuoso and songwriter, best known for his work (and solos) with other artists like Billy Idol and Vince Neil.

name: Jens Thele
comments: Former A&R manager gone club owner, label founder ( Kontor and Sheffield Tunes ), artist manager and more. Also the mastermind behind Scooter .

aliases: Cyril Ornadel and His Westminster Orch. Of London
Cyril Ornadel and His Westminster Orchestra Of London

name: Georgi Gogow
comments: Bulgaria born violinist, vocalist and arranger

name: Thomas McClary
comments: Soul music guitarist, producer and singer-songwriter.

name: Sammy Burwell
comments: Hip hop artist, better known by his stage name "DJ Sammy B".

name: Nathaniel Hall
comments: Hip hop artist, born in Brooklyn, New York. Also active as producer and songwriter. Better known under his stage name "Afrika Baby Bam", a homage to Afrika Bambaataa .

name: Michael Small [US1]
comments: Hip hop artist, born in Brooklyn, New York. Better known under his stage name "Mike Gee".

name: Stony Browder Jr.

name: Lonnie Simmons

name: Gerry Goffin
comments: Lyricist and songwriter, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1987

name: Les Baxter
aliases: Les Baxter - His Chorus and Orchestra
Les Baxter His Chorus and Orchestra
Les Baxter His Piano, Chorus and Orchestra
comments: Musician, singer, conductor and composer, whose show business career spanned six decades. Baxter composed more than 250 scores for radio, television and the movies. The 1950s pioneer of orchestral lounge music also was the music arranger for the 'Bob Hope' and 'Abbott and Costello' radio shows. His Top 10 hits included 'Unchained Melody', 'Poor People of Paris', 'Lisbon Antigua' and 'Quiet Village'. His movie credits include scores for films such as 'The Pit and the Pendulum'. 'The Man with the X-Ray Eyes' and 'Beach Blanket Bingo'.

name: Donald Fagen
comments: Best known as the co-founder, lead singer and keyboardist of the band Steely Dan

name: Greg Prestopino
comments: Songwriter, including for television and film, record producer and vocalist

comments: Spoken word artist, poet, musician from Chicago, Illinois

name: J-Remy

comments: Colombian-American DJ, producer and record label owner

aliases: The Billy Rubin Trio ft. Lady S.
comments: Swing jazz band reinterpreting modern pop/rock songs, with lead singer Lady S.

name: Len Arran
comments: Songwriter. His credits include writing scores for TV and films.

name: William Barbero
comments: UK-based gypsy jazz / jazz guitarist and composer

name: José Hoebee
comments: Dutch pop singer, who was a member of Luv', a Dutch girl group in the late 1970s and early 1980s, which scored hits in a dozen European countries. In late 1981 she went solo and was successful in her homeland and in the Flanders region of Belgium between 1982 and 1985. She formed an occasional duo known as Bonnie & José with Dutch singer Bonnie St. Claire to record Dutch cover versions of some of ABBA's works.

name: Hans Vermeulen
comments: Singer, guitarist, keyboardist, composer and producer, active since the early 1960s.

name: The Fantastic Dee-Jays
comments: Pittsburgh garage band.  Precursor to Swamp Rats

name: I Got Shot in the Face
Jason Derülo
comments: Singer, songwriter, dancer and record producer

name: Roseanna Vitro
comments: Jazz singer born in Hot Springs, Arkansas

name: De Karekieten
comments: Children's choir from Hilversum under the direction of Willy François. Active during the 1950s and 1960s.

name: Ger de Roos
aliases: Ger de Roos en het Orkest Zonder Naam
Ger de Roos and His Nameless Orchestra
Orkest Zonder Naam o.l.v. Ger de Roos met zang van Marketensters
comments: Dutch band leader, composer, arranger. The "Orkest Zonder Naam" under direction of Ger de Roos was active between 1946 and 1954.

name: Mike Mainieri
comments: Jazz/rock/experimental vibraphonist, pianist, songwriter and producer.

name: Kevin Rudolf
comments: Rock/hip hop singer-songwriter, guitarist and producer from New York City

name: Omar
comments: Soul singer, songwriter and musician. He is sometimes credited as Omar Hammer (his stepfather's surname).

name: Buddy DeFranco
aliases: Buddy De Franco and His Orchestra
comments: Jazz clarinetist born in Camden, New Jersey and raised in nearby Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.  DeFranco started out as a swing and big band player, but became one of the relatively few bop clarinet players.

name: Jason Rebello
comments: Jazz and pop pianist.  He has played in Sting's studio and touring bands.

name: Kenny Washington
comments: Jazz drummer mostly recorded as a sideman.

name: Brian Blade
comments: Jazz drummer who has regularly recorded as a leader, co-leader and sideman.

name: Rodney Whitaker
comments: Jazz bassist and currently professor of double bass and director of jazz studies at Michigan State University.

name: Carfax Abbey
comments: Goth / industrial band based in Philadelphia

name: The Anix
comments: Electronic/industrial project from Los Angeles formed in 2001 by Brandon Smith (vocals, guitar, keyboards, bass, programming), Bryan Lareau (guitar, bass) and Oscar Gutierrez (drums) as a full electronic/alternative rock band

name: I Will Never Be the Same
Johnny Reid
comments: Country musician and songwriter born in Lanark, Scotland, and moved to Canada in his youth.  He currently resides in Nashville, Tennessee.

name: Pamela Stephenson
comments: New Zealand-born comedy actress and writer. She is also a clinical psychologist.

name: Rowan Atkinson
comments: Comedy actor and writer, well known for his roles on "Not the 9 O-Clock News", "Blackadder" (and spinoffs) and "Mr. Bean".

name: The Users
comments: Punk band from Cambridge, formed in 1976.

name: Vanishing Kids
comments: Indie rock/electro band based in Portland, Oregon

name: Joel Plaskett
comments: Indie multi-instrumentalist, singer and songwriter from Nova Scotia.

name: Dik
comments: English-born guitarist, best known as a founder of the band Virgin Prunes and an early member of U2

name: Black Sun Productions
comments: Massimo & Pierce of Black Sun Productions a.k.a. the Anarcocks are a duo of performers and sound experimentalists operating and transmitting from LOFT23, a non-geographical location in Switzerland.

name: James Blake
comments: Electronic music producer and singer-songwriter from London

name: Corona
comments: Brazilian-Italian singer, model and dancer, best known as the frontwoman of the Italian group Corona

name: John Britt
comments: U.S. Navy petty officer and singer

name: Buddy Greene
comments: Christian singer, songwriter, and instrumentalist who is known for his harmonica playing. Greene's music has a wide variety of southern American influences, encompassing country, bluegrass, folk, gospel and traditional blues.

name: The Insyderz
comments: Christian ska band from Detroit, Michigan

name: Dean Boudreau
comments: Electro/experimental singer-songwriter based in Nova Scotia.

name: Jussi Tuominen
comments: Lyricist, television writer and producer born in Tampere

name: David Courtney
comments: Singer-songwriter and producer from Brighton, East Sussex. As a songwriter he regularly worked with Adam Faith and Leo Sayer . As a musician he released one album in 1975.

name: Indigo Swing
comments: Swing band from San Francisco. Members include vocalist Johnny Boyd , guitarist Josh Workman, bassist Vance Ehlers, drummer "Big Jim" Overton, pianist William Beatty and saxophone player Baron Shul.

name: Susperia
comments: Death metal band based in Haslum.

name: Saul Williams
comments: Rapper, singer, songwriter, musician, poet, writer, and actor

name: Megaherz
comments: Rock band from Eichenau, Bavaria. One of the so called Neue deutsche Härte bands.

name: The Last Town Chorus
comments: Americana project formed by Megan Hickey that includes a revolving group of supporting musicians. Hickey is a singer-songwriter and lap steel guitarist.

name: Elina Duni
comments: Jazz singer born in Tirana. In 1992 she moved to Switzerland.

name: Electrøn Love Theory
comments: Producer and musician based in Seattle

name: Kalmah
comments: Melodic death metal band from Pudasjärvi

name: Yonrinsha
comments: Four piece pop punk band from Tokyo

name: Joey Vindictive
comments: Chicago, IL based punk rock singer and songwriter

name: Fecri Ebcioğlu
comments: Composer, lyricist, arranger, DJ and singer

name: Yaşar
comments: Pop singer, poet, actor and guitarist

name: Fifty Foot Hose
comments: Rock group from San Francisco, mixing psychedelia with avant-garde electronica produced on home-made instruments.

name: The Courteeners
comments: English indie rock band formed in Middleton in 2006.

name: Donald Fletcher
comments: Soul songwriter who worked at Motown in the 70s, with Hal Davis and Dean Parks

name: Sandra Reaves-Phillips
comments: Soul and R&B singer and actress

name: The Groovy Little Numbers
comments: Indie pop band from Bellshill, Lanarkshire, Scotland

name: The Sea Urchins
comments: Indie pop band from West Bromwich, England. First to release a single on their label, Sarah Records.

name: The Microphones
comments: Experimental folk project of Phil Elvrum. Phil released music under this moniker from 1996 through 2004 before he began making music under the name Mount Eerie.

name: The Very Most
aliases: The Very Most - Lions and Eagles

name: Teresa Teng
comments: Legendary pop singer, most popular in Chinese-speaking countries and Chinese communities worldwide. As the saying goes, "there's at least one Teresa Teng record in every Chinese household". During the Cultural Revolution, her songs were banned in China (they were "capitalist and decadent") but she managed to acquire legions of fans there, too. In the 1990's, when Mainlanders were allowed to travel abroad, they were shocked to see that she had become out of fashion. For the social and cultural impact of Teng's music, see the 1996 Hong Kong film "Comrades: Almost a Love Story".

name: Shirley Kwan
comments: Cantopop singer. An innovator and an influential figure in Cantonese pop music, her trademark style is a mix of traditional pop songwriting and cutting-edge production techniques.

name: Wong Jim
comments: Prolific and successful Cantopop lyricist, Wong was also a composer, actor, film director, screenwriter, and TV presenter. Born in China, migrated to Hong Kong with his family in 1949.

name: Caustic Resin
comments: Indie rock band from Boise, Idaho.

name: Jacky Cheung
comments: Actor and singer, he is considered one of the "Four Heavenly Kings of Cantopop".

name: Homer Haynes
comments: Country music singer, guitarist, comedian and lyricist

name: Jethro Burns
comments: Country music singer, mandolin player, lyricist, and comedian

name: Tisha Campbell
comments: Popular American television and movie actress.

name: Brownstone
comments: Female R&B trio from the '90s. Original members were Monica "Mimi" Doby, Charmayne "Maxee" Maxwell (deceased 2015) and Nichole "Nicci" Gilbert.

name: The Sting Rays [US1]
comments: Garage rock band based in Long Island, New York.

name: Little Annie
comments: singer, painter, poet, writer, performing and recording artist, pastor, and stage actress

name: Radoslav Graić
comments: Mrkonjić, Bosnia, born lyricist, singer, composer and music director of Телевизије Београд (= Television Belgrade). He stopped singing in 1968 and concentrated on other activities. After retiring he lived in Belgrade.

name: Nada Knežević
comments: Serbian schlager and jazz singer born in Belgrade

name: Ivan Rebroff
comments: Singer, allegedly of Russian ancestry, with an extraordinary vocal range of four and a half octaves ranging from the soprano to bass registers. He pretended to be a Russian, which was just a part of his act.

name: Martin Hurkens
comments: Opera singer, with alias Martin, who won the third season of Holland's Got Talent in 2010

name: Felice Romani
comments: Poet and scholar in literature and mythology, who wrote many librettos for the opera composers Gaetano Donizetti and Vincenzo Bellini . He was considered the finest Italian librettist of his day.

name: Carlos Toro
comments: Songwriter, who wrote more than 700 songs while working as a reporter for the newspaper "El Mundo".

name: Francisco Tárrega
comments: Composer and classical guitarist, born in Villarreal. He was known as the "Sarasate of the guitar" (Pablo de Sarasate was a violin virtuoso). He invented various new playing techniques and had a great influence on the popularity of classical guitar in the 20th century.

name: Helene Fischer
aliases: The Crossed Swords Pipes & Drums & Helene Fischer
comments: Original Russian spelling of the name: Елена Петровна Фишер. Schlager singer and presenter born in Siberia and emigrating to Germany with her parents at the age of four. After finishing secondary school, she attended a musical performance academy. Since signing to a leading German schlager management/media producer, Fis(c)her from 2010 onwards increasingly became successful in the German-speaking countries. She also appears in numerous advertising campaigns for cosmetic products etc.

name: Kerry Ellis
aliases: Kerry Ellis with West End Stage
comments: Actress and singer, best known for her work in musical theatre

name: Ciro Pessoa
comments: Singer-songwriter, lyricist, guitarist, screenwriter, journalist, writer and poet, famous for being one of the founding members of the influential rock band Titãs and for his later work with pioneering post-punk/gothic rock band Cabine C.

name: Branco Mello
personal_name: Joaquim Cláudio Corrêa de Mello Jr

name: The Flakes
comments: American garage rock'n'roll band from San Francisco, California

name: The Mighty Hannibal
comments: American R&B, soul and funk singer, songwriter and record producer.

name: The Gadabouts
comments: Chicago based trio consisting of Larry Craig, Johnnie Barr and Eddie Hayes. Thet were active in the mid 1950s.

name: The Fearsome Foursome
comments: The Los Angeles Rams (American Football) front line of 1965, consisting of Deacon Jones, Merlin Olsen, Charlie Cowan, and Lamar Lundy, issued one sole single

name: Megapuss
comments: Duo project initially started out as a joke, fleshed out with three other members.

name: All Leather
comments: Featuring Justin Pearson and Zach Fiocca.

name: Tearist
comments: Experimental electronic performance duo from Los Angeles

name: Zaza
comments: Electronic music band from New York City, NY.

name: Rituals of Mine
comments: Indie pop/electronic/alt R&B duo from Sacramento, California. Formerly known as Sister Crayon.

name: Lights [US]
comments: Band from Brooklyn, New York, featuring vocalist/guitarist Sophia Knapp, drummer/vocalist Linnea Vedder and a rotating cast of other players.  In 2009, they changed name to Cliffie Swan to avoid confusion with the Canadian pop artist.

name: DJ Frank E
comments: DJ and record producer from Denver, Colorado.

name: Toto Coelo
comments: Pop group, known in USA as Total Coelo to avoid confusion with rock band Toto

name: Wiet Van de Leest
comments: Musician (alt-violin, banjo, piano), singer and songwriter

name: Koos Speenhof
comments: Poet, singer-songwriter, illustrator and painter, born in Kralingen

name: Rum
comments: Flemish folk act. Original members: Paul Rans, Dirk Van Esbroeck & Wiet Van De Leest.

name: Sonny Tufts
comments: Stage, film and television actor and opera singer.

name: Fish & Roses
comments: Avant pop trio formed in New York City in the fall of 1985, including singer/drummer Rick Brown (who had played in Blinding Headache, Information, and V-Effect), his wife, singer/bassist Sue Garner (who had played in Vietnam, and Last Roundup), and keyboarder Dave Sutter. They only released two albums and two singles/EPs.

name: The Calling
comments: Rock band based in Los Angeles, California

name: Ottmar Liebert
comments: Cologne born acoustic guitar player living in the US since the 1980s. Five times Grammy nominee Liebert is known for his Spanish-influenced easy listening music.

name: Mats Hallgren
comments: Journalist and foreign correspondent, but also lyricist especially for Lill Lindfors

name: Johnny Pearson
comments: Composer, arranger, band leader and pianist. Many of his compositions were used as the theme music to television programmes, including ITN's "News at Ten".

name: Félix Luna
comments: Historian, writer, journalist, poet, musician and lyricist from La Rioja

name: Laila Kinnunen
comments: One of the greatest singers of Finnish popular music in the 1950s and 1960s, who recorded in Finnish, but also in Swedish, Hungarian, German, English, Italian and Spanish.

name: Кукрыниксы [Kukrynisky]
comments: Rock band founded by Alexei Gorshenyov (Yagoda), the younger brother of Mikhail Gorshenyov (Gorshka), leader of the band Король и Шут (King and Jester). The name of the group derives from the famous trio of Soviet cartoonists "Kukryniksy": Mikhail Kupriyanov, Porfiry Krylov and Nikolai Sokolov.

name: Guy d'Hardelot
comments: Composer and pianist born in Samer

name: Edward Teschemacher
comments: Lyricist, translator, arranger, librettist and popular music composer responsible for writing and co-writing a number of well-known pieces including "Because" (1902) and co-writing "I'll Walk Beside You" (1939). He wrote most of his lyrics between 1900 and the late 1920s. His work as a translator includes translating "Mattinata" from Italian to English in 1904, translating a series of folksongs from Norwegian and Danish to English and translating the "Mariae Wiegenlied" (The Virgin's Slumber Song) from its native German to English in 1917.

name: Eddie Cole
comments: Jazz singer, bassist, pianist and actor

name: Robert Conrad
comments: Actor, singer and stuntman. According to some sources, he was born Konrad Robert Falkowski. His father was German, so Conrad Falk could be an Americanization.

name: Dorothy Provine
comments: Singer, dancer, actress and comedian best known for her role as Pinky Pinkham in "The Roaring 20's", an American drama television series that aired on ABC from October 15, 1960, until January 20, 1962.

name: Clint Walker
aliases: Clint Walker and The Sunset Serenaders

name: Roger Moore
comments: Actor, most notably in Ivanhoe, The Saint, The Persuaders, and as "James Bond" (1971-1985).

name: Eldar
comments: Born in Kyrgyzstan while it was still part of the Soviet Union, jazz pianist Eldar moved to the United States at age 10, and is now based in New York City.  Eldar is also a composer.

name: Carson and Gaile
comments: Duo consisting of Parks and his wife Gaile Foote

name: Handsome Hank and His Lonesome Boys
comments: Country and bluegrass band based in Basel

name: White Lies
comments: English post-punk band from Ealing, London. Formerly known as Fear of Flying the core band members are Harry McVeigh (lead vocals, guitar), Charles Cave (bass guitar and backing vocals) and Jack Lawrence-Brown (drums).

name: Östen Warnerbring
comments: Songwriter and producer, he is also manager of the record label Oktav [SE]

name: Gry
comments: Pop singer, who for her career in the German market from the late 1980's to the early 1990's used the stage name Bo Andersen.

name: Alessandro Casillo
comments: Singer launched by the contest "Io canto

name: Federica Bensi
comments: Soul singer from Livorno, contestant in The Voice of Italy

name: Kevan Giulia
comments: Singer and contestant in TV talent show Io canto

name: Elvya Garofano
comments: Singer from Crotone and contestant in talent TV show Io canto

name: The VSS
comments: Hardcore punk band from Boulder, CO

name: Nicolas Bozzato
comments: Singer from Jesolo and contestant in kids talent TV show io canto in 2010

name: Benedetta del Freo
comments: Singer from Montignoso and contestant in TV talent show Io Canto in 2011.

name: Manuel Sciacca
comments: Singer born in Aci Catena and contestant in kids talent TV show in 2010

name: Freshlyground
comments: Afro-fusion band that formed in Cape Town

name: Maya Pieri
comments: Singer from Siracusa and contestant in TV talent show io canto in 2010. She also auditioned in Britain's Got Talent.

name: Claudia Sciortino
comments: Singer from Palermo and contestant in kids TV talent show ti lascio una canzone in 2010

name: Mădălina Lefter
comments: Singer born in Iași winner in kids talent TV show Ti lascio una canzone in 2010 and contestnat in Eurovision Junior

name: Mattia Lever
comments: Singer from Zambana and winner of kids talent TV show ti lascio una canzone fourth edition in 2010

name: Roberto Cantoral
comments: Mexican composer, singer and songwriter. He was known for composing a string of hit Mexican songs including "El triste", "Al final", "La barca" and "El reloj"

name: Camille Saint-Saëns
comments: Composer, organist, pianist, conductor and music teacher of the Romantic era

name: Salvatore Montagna
comments: Singer from Maglie and contestant in kids talent TV show Ti lascio una canzone in 2010

name: Stefano Ricci
comments: Singer from  Anguillara Sabazia and contestant in kids TV talent show ti lascio una canzone

name: Davide Rossi
comments: Violinist, string arranger, composer, conductor and a record producer, but perhaps best known for having been the violinist, guitar and keytar-player for the British electronic music duo Goldfrapp from 2000 until 2013 and for his large contribution of electric violin parts and for all the string arrangements on all Coldplay's albums since "Viva la Vida" or "Death and All His Friends" and The Verve's album "Forth".

name: Claudia Catalano
comments: Singer from Palermo and contestant i kids talent TV show ti lascio una canzone in 2010

name: Giacomo Iraci
comments: Singer from Palermo and contestant in TV talent show Ti lascio una canzone in 2010

name: Curt Jalmo
comments: Singer, musician and poet born in Bromma, Stockholm

name: Francesca Pallini
comments: Singer from Cortona and contestant in kids TV talent show ti lascio una canzone in 2010

name: Clarence Bassett
comments: Doo wop tenor singer in the 1950s/1960s

name: Shep and The Limelites
comments: Rhythm & Blues vocal trio from Queens, New York City.

name: Jane Child
comments: Dance pop singer-songwriter, keyboardist and producer.

name: The Shake Spears
comments: Ska group existing between 1963 and 1969, heralding from Northern Rhodesia, now Zambia, but mainly active in Belgium.

name: Eric Imhauser
comments: Composer and music producer, based in Brussels. Started his career in the early 1990's.

name: Johan Boonen
comments: Classicist, lyricist, translator and playwright who also worked for radio, television and film. From 1963 to 1987 he was a teacher of classical languages, ancient culture, Dutch and aesthetics at the Maria-Boodschaplyceum in Brussels.

name: Jean-Claude Darnal
aliases: Jean-Claude Darnal chante avec les enfants
comments: TV host, singer, composer, translator and writer, born in Douai, Nord

name: K.C. Porter
comments: Record producer, songwriter, musician and singer

name: Arnie Roman
comments: Soul and pop songwriter active since the early 1980s.

name: Andrew Fromm
comments: Songwriter from Edison, New Jersey, currently living in Nashville, Tennessee.

name: Ron Block
comments: Banjo and acoustic guitar session player born in Gardena, California

name: Melvin Davis
comments: Soul singer, songwriter, drummer, producer, and record label owner (Rock Mill Records).

name: Grin
comments: Pop/rock band formed in 1968 and led by Nils Lofgren.  Grin disbanded in 1974.

name: 4th Disciple
comments: Hip-hop DJ, producer and engineer, part of the The Wu Elements and the Wu-Tang Clan's producers team

name: Young Disciples
comments: Soul group, active in the early 1990s.

name: Nicolas Bonnière
comments: Guitarist, songwriter also known as Nikko

name: Michaël Chamberlin
comments: Also known as Micka, bass player

name: Gerrit Komrij
comments: Poet, novelist, translator, lyricist, critic, polemic journalist and playwright.

name: Volebeats
comments: Alternative country band from Detroit, Michigan

name: Jim Owen
comments: Country singer and songwriter, originally from Robards, Kentucky

name: Jo Van Wetter
comments: Songwriter/guitar player who had his biggest successes in the 1960s.

name: Dries Holten
comments: Performer, producer and songwriter of Indo descent, who is best known under his alias Andres. He represented The Netherlands at the 1972 Eurovision Song Contest alongside Sandra Reemer . After he and Reemer broke up Holten formed a new group with Rosy Pereira and called it Rosy & Andres. In 1980 Holten's final group was himself and Ria Shield Meyer.

name: Dicks & Janes
comments: Coed a cappella group from the University of Michigan.

name: The Froncysyllte Male Voice Choir
comments: The choir was established in 1947 to compete in the male voice competition at the Llangollen International Musical Eisteddfod following the success of the inaugural International Eisteddfod that year.

name: Carmen Masola
comments: Opera singer Winner of season 1 (2009) of Italia's Got Talent

name: Spirit of the West
comments: Folk rock band from North Vancouver, British Columbia

name: Windwalker
comments: From Vancouver, British Columbia. Featuring Philippe Doebeli, Anthony Hempell, Brendan McCabe and Stuart Oijen.

name: Papa Sprain & Butterfly Child
comments: From London, England. Featuring Gary McKendry, Joe Cassidy and Rudy Tambala.

name: Black Sox
comments: From Montreal, Quebec. Also featuring Steve Kravac, Stepan Hams and Clive MacNutt.

name: Superconductor
comments: From Vancouver, British Columbia. Featuring Warren Westling, Carl Newman, Mike Kerley, Sean Elliot, Scott Gubbels, Keith Parry, Pat Hogue, Mike Rohally and Brian Gillard.

name: Dick Wellstood
aliases: Dick Wellstood and the Friends of Fats
comments: One of only a few stride pianists to hit the scene during the rise of bebop in the 1940s, Wellstood was a well regarded traditional jazz player.

name: M/A/R/R/S
comments: One-off recording act formed by brothers Steven and Martyn Young (from Colourbox),  Alex Ayuli, Rudy Tambala and Russell Smith (from A.R. Kane), producer John Fryer and DJs "C.J." Mackintosh and Dave Dorrell. Both A.R. Kane and Colourbox wanted to release a house music record. Ivo Watts-Russell, owner of the label 4AD , suggested they work together. Initial recording sessions didn't go very well, so the two groups decided to record, separately, one track each. The final result was the single "Pump Up the Volume" (created by Colourbox) b/w "Anitina (The First Time I See She Dance)" (created by A.R. Kane).

name: Topmost
comments: Pop group in the late 1960s and at the time one of the most popular groups in Finland.

name: The Priests [GB]
comments: Classical musical group comprising three Roman Catholic priests from Northern Ireland: Fr David Delargy and brothers Fr Eugene and Fr Martin O'Hagan.

name: Huford Brown
comments: Producer and DJ, perhaps better known as U Brown

name: Al Van Dam
comments: Musician, composer and record producer, also SABAM vicepresident honorario

name: The London Jazz Four
comments: Formation mainly known for soft-jazzy Beatles recordings. Also appearing as L'J IV and The London Jazz Quartet.

name: Steve Acho
comments: Singer-songwriter and pianist based in Detroit, Michigan

name: Hinder
comments: Hard rock band based in Oklahoma.

name: Fenriz
comments: Primarily a drummer, Fenriz has also sung and played bass and guitar during his career as a musician.

name: Les Champions
comments: Started with some members of Les Satellites and changed their name into Les Champions. Jean-Claude Champon (vocals), Claude Ciari (guitar), Willy Lewis (drums) and Alain Santamaria (guitar).

name: Laura Migliacci
comments: Lyricist, singer, actress, author of television and radio programs

name: Berto Pisano
aliases: Directed and arranged by Berto Pisano

name: Pertti Kilpeläinen
comments: Drummer and singer from Helsinki, Finland.

name: Alexander Gordan
comments: Multi-instrumentalist, singer, leader of various singing groups and songwriter. Using the Detlev alias, he in the 1970s recorded versions of hits with self-altered gay lyrics.

name: Silvio Francesco
aliases: Silvio Francesco und sein Twist Club
comments: Paris, France, born singer, multi-instrumentalist, dancer, and actor.

name: Jean Vanhoren
comments: Musician, arranger, composer and orchestra leader

name: Joop de Leur
comments: Dutch pianist, composer and artist manager born in Rotterdam.

name: Robin Wilson [US2]
comments: Primarily a vocalist, Wilson also plays guitar and writes songs.

name: No Nonsense
comments: Anne Mie Gils, Mitta Van der Maat, Hilde Van Hulle & Wanda Joosten

name: The Soulful Strings
comments: Studio project of the Chicago soul producer Richard Evans, releasing a repertoire composed almost entirely of covers. Between the years of 1966 and 1971, Evans worked with several musicians from the Cadet Records house band to record six LP’s and several singles. The members of the band included Charles Stepney, Bobby Christian, Billy Wooten, Phil Upchurch, Lennie Druss, and Cleveland Eaton.

name: Clancy Hayes
comments: Vocalist, and jazz multi-instrumentalist known principally for Dixieland jazz. His primary instrument was the six string banjo.

name: Bernice Williams
comments: Songwriter active in the Chicago doo wop and rhythm & blues scene. She discovered Gene Chandler.

name: Pierre van Duijl
comments: Singer from Rotterdam. He played the role of a Greek in Ja zuster, nee zuster (movie) .

name: Gerard van Maasakkers
aliases: Gerard van Maasakkers en De Vaste Mannen
comments: Folk singer from Noord-Brabant, who mainly sings in his own dialect

name: KGB [1]
comments: Hip-Hop group from Coney Island and Brooklyn and Wu-Tang affiliate.

name: Eventide
comments: A band that fused medieval and Middle Eastern sounds.

name: Louie Bellson
aliases: The Louie Bellson Quintet featuring Ted Nash
Louis Bellson His Drums and Orchestra
personal_name: Luigi Paulino Alfredo Francesco Antonio Ballasoni

name: Last Year's Model
comments: Pop band based in New york City.

name: Against the Stars
comments: Alt band based in Somerville, Massachusetts.

name: Razed in a New Division of Agony
The Artificial Sea
comments: Experimental electro duo, Alina Simone and Kevin C. Smith.

name: Clément Nicolas
comments: Lyricist, a.o. for Charles Aznavour and Dalida

name: Teddy Charles
comments: Jazz pianist, drummer and vibraphonist born in Chicopee Falls, Massachusetts

name: Rusty Dedrick
aliases: Rusty Dedrick and the All Star Orchestra
Rusty Dedrick and the All Star Orchestra and Septet
Rusty Dedrick and the All Star Septet
Rusty Dedrick and The Winds Of Change

name: The Boerenzonen op Speed
comments: Trip hop band from Leuven. Active 1996 - 1999.

name: Bob Azzam
aliases: Bob Azzam and the Great Expectations
